Prototrade

  • View page source

Quickstart

  1. Use pip install prototrade -U to install the latest version of the package

  2. Create a new python file (e.g. script.py) and paste in the minimal boilerplate strategy .

  3. Use python3 script.py to run the boilerplate code. Refer to the Key Points below for an explanation

  4. Look at the example strategies section for more ideas of how the framework operates.

Creating a Strategy

Below are the key components needed for creating a strategy. See the minimal boilerplate strategy for an example.

  • Create a strategy function, following the same format as the boilerplate strategy. This should take in an Exchange object as its first argument.

The Exchange is how a strategy can retrieve the latest quotes for subscribed stocks and place orders for symbols. The strategy function can also take in other user defined parameters. - Subscribe to desired symbols using the Exchange member function of the Exchange object. - Create a while loop that repeatedly checks whether the exchange is running with the member function is_running - Use get_subscribed_quotes to get the latest quotes for all the stocks that are subscribed to. - To submit orders, use the create_order member function. - Orders can be cancelled with the cancel_order member function. - To access historical data use the Historical Property

  • See the Exchange for more functions.

Registering Strategies for execution

  • Import the VirtualExchange

  • In a main() function, create an instance of the VirtualExchange class

  • Use the member function, register_strategy to register a function/strategy to the framework VirtualExchange

  • When all strategies are registered, use the member function, run_strategies to start the simulated execution of the strategies.

The Exchange Class

The Exchange argument to each strategy function is the primary way of interacting with the Prototrade framework.

  • Submit orders to the framework using

  • Cancel orders using

Common Errors

  • Ensure that the Python script is starting using format below. Otherwise a freeze_support error can occur.

::
if __name__ == ‘__main__’:

main()
